name: 余盛延
objective:
本課程旨在透過各種英語新聞媒體如電視新聞（如 CNN, BBC, NBC）、英文雜誌（如 The Economist, Scientific American ）、英文報紙（New York Times, Washington Post, the Guardian 等）等，來培養學生的批判性閱讀能力．並同時提升其宏觀視野與多元知識。課堂中將藉由分析英語新聞的用字遣詞、報導角度的取捨、標題與議題的呈現方式等，使學生學習如何思考報導背後之立場，從而進行批判性閱讀。此外，亦將剖析英語新聞中所含括之英美文學典故與文化傳統，帶領學生瞭解新聞英文的豐富意涵。
This course aims to (1) develop students’ critical reading abilities, (2) expand their global horizons and (3) broaden their knowledge by using diverse English news reports provided by news channels (e.g. CNN, BBC and NBC), news magazines (e.g. The Economist and Scientific American) and newspapers (e.g. New York Times, Washington Post and The Guardian). Students will learn how to read critically by analyzing word choice, reporting angles and the selection and presentation of headlines or quotations. This course will also explore literary allusions and cultural references contained in English news in order to further enhance students’ English language competence.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction
Course overview and expectations
Introduction to news literacy and the importance of critical thinking in media consumption
No specific chapter reading

Week 2-3:
Understanding Fake News: Historical Context

The origins and historical evolution of fake news

Reading: Chapter 1

Week 4-5:
Analyzing News Sources
Identifying bias, agendas, and credibility of news sources
Reading: Chapter 2

Week 6:
Techniques for Identifying Fake News
Practical methods and tools for spotting fake news
Reading: Chapter 2 (continued)

Week 7:
Holiday
No class

Week 8:
Critical Framework for News Literacy
Higdon’s fake news detection kit and critical analysis
Reading: Chapter 3

Week 9:
Midterm Exam
Covering Chapters 1-3

Week 10:
General English Proficiency Exam
University-wide examination for all sophomores

Week 11-12:
The Role of Media in Society
Media’s impact on public perception and society
Reading: Chapter 4

Week 13-14:
Current Trends and Challenges in Media
Contemporary issues in the media landscape
Reading: Chapter 5

Week 15-16:
Media Manipulation and Misinformation
How media manipulation works and its implications
Reading: Chapter 6

Week 17:
Practical Applications and Case Studies
Applying learned skills to real-world examples and case studies
Reading: Chapter 7

Week 18:
Final Exam
Covering Chapters 4-7
